result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey J. Barry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**   Pay fine of $700.00   and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided)
** Pay DNA surcharges.  Perform 40 hours of community service work for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organizaation.    May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey J. Barry

Discharge - Regular
DE has satisfied his financial obligations so the Probation Review Hearing is canceled for 9/16/16.
Email correspondence received from Agt Deschner stating DE has satisfied his financial obligations so no probation review will be necessary on 9/16/16.
Probation review hearing on September 16, 2016 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Corey J. Barry, appeared with Attorney Kevin T. Noonan.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI is waived by parties and sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  Credit for 1 day if revoked.  As a condition he is ordered to complete 40 hrs of community service.  Court imposes a fine of $700 plus costs to be paid during supervision and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Corey J. Barry, appeared with Attorney Kevin T. Noonan.  Clerk: PT
Atty Noonan requests an adjournment for further discovery and resolution; no objection by the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant, Corey J. Barry, appeared with Attorney Kevin T. Noonan. Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens.

Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
